cnbc.title: Transportation Sec. Duffy warns air travel will be 'reduced to a trickle,' with flight cancellations worsening as the shutdown drags on
cnbc.summary: Airlines will have to slash hundreds of more flights if shutdown continues into next week.

cnbc.title: Trump administration demands that states 'undo' full SNAP benefit payments
cnbc.summary: The Trump administration has resisted continuing the SNAP program, which provides food stamps to 42 million Americans, during the government shutdown.

cnbc.title: Cleveland Guardians pitchers indicted for scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown
cnbc.summary: According to the indictment, Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz took bribes as part of a scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown during MLB games.

cnbc.title: China consumer prices return to growth in October, producer price slump extends to three years
cnbc.summary: Deflation in China eased in October, as consumer prices returned to growth after falling for two straight months, though producer prices extended their slump to three years.

cnbc.title: Trump tells Senate Republicans to send federal health insurance money 'directly to the people'
cnbc.summary: President Trump proposed a new potential compromise on health insurance payments.

cnbc.title: Supreme Court pauses order that Trump administration must pay full SNAP benefits
cnbc.summary: The Trump administration tried not to pay for any food stamps in November because of the government shutdown. It now proposes partial SNAP benefits.

cnbc.title: New U.S. nuclear power boom begins with old, still-unsolved problem: What to do with radioactive waste
cnbc.summary: As government and industry, from tech giants to utilities, commit to big nuclear power plants, there is still no clear solution for radioactive waste storage.

cnbc.title: Global week ahead: AI wobble casts shadow over 'Davos for geeks'
cnbc.summary: After a volatile week for AI stocks and the tech sector more broadly, CNBC travels to Web Summit in Lisbon — 'Davos for geeks' — to assess sentiment.

cnbc.summary: Kai Yang Chan and JiaYi Zhuo matched on Tinder as teenagers in 2019. Now, they are married and run a $650,000 a year cake business together in Singapore.

cnbc.title: 34-year-old was saving to buy a house, then decided to focus on early retirement instead: 'I value my time more than home ownership'
cnbc.summary: In 2020, Anita Kinoshita started her journey to buy a home. After many failed attempts over two years, she decided to start saving to retire early instead.
